title: Tassel, 17th century
medium:
Medium: linen, metal wire, silk
Technique: braided and knotted
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Linen tassel, braided and knotted. Single loop attached to pear-shaped unit from which hang three elaborate knottings in shape of human figures holding on to one another. From bottom of pear-shaped unit hangs a ball decoration, with smaller knotted balls. Silk bows stitched to top part of pear-shaped unit. Hair of human figures made of tarnished metal wire.

tombstone.epitaph:
Tassel, 17th century.
17th century. Medium: linen, metal wire, silk
Technique: braided and knotted. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-51-25.
